title: SEO Basics - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Cyrus Shepard May 28, 2014 Take the SEO Expert Quiz and Rule the Internet Technical SEO | Advanced SEO | SEO Basics You are master of the keyword. You create 1,000 links with a single tweet. Google engineers ask for your approval before updating their algorithm. You, my friend, are an SEO Expert. Prove it by taking our new SEO Expert Quiz. Read this post By: Bill Sebald May 22, 2014 How Our Agency Survived Year One SEO Basics These are the lessons I learned while building Greenlane Search Marketing: some "outside" thinking on ways to make your digital marketing agency or department successful. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers May 14, 2014 Starting Over, Part 3 - Optimize SEO Basics Once your site is launched and indexed, it's time to sand off the rough SEO edges. Part 3 in the "Starting Over" covers how to do a quick, early SEO audit. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers April 22, 2014 Starting Over, Part 2: Launch SEO Basics After months of building and planning, it's understandable to want to finally pull the trigger, but launch is important and rushing it can delay real success. This is the story of how I got Minimal Talent off the ground. Read this post By: Brandon Seymour September 9, 2013 Inbound Marketing and SEO for Bands and Musicians SEO Basics What I find really interesting though is that some niches act as if they are immune to the constant pressures of the modern day marketer. In my experience, one of the biggest offenders is the music industry - specifically independent artists. I've been working in SEO and inbound marketing for about four years now and since I've always had a passion for music, I wanted to take some time to discuss some simple, highly actionable steps that musicians can take to start marketing their band like a boss. Read this post J By: Jesse Landry August 19, 2013 Kick-starting Your SEO Efforts When You're Just Not Feelin' It SEO Basics It's times like these that you truly need something to kick-start your day and keep it from becoming another one of those lost weekdays where you get home and wonder what you accomplished. (Hint: probably nothing.) Here is a list of a few easy things to look at SEO-wise that might just ignite a little passion, creativity, or drive to your day: Read this post By: Aamir Jiwa July 18, 2013 9 Experts and a Summary: What Makes an Ideal SEO Employee? SEO Basics What do the best and brightest SEOs in the US and the UK look for when they are hiring? Read on to find out. Take note: Their answers may surprise you. Read this post By: Dave Robinson December 10, 2012 A Simple Error that Tanked My Site and Stopped My Heart SEO Basics Earlier this year a number of our sites tanked and when I say tanked I mean THEY TANKED. Not only did visits dry up, as a result of their rankings evaporating, but all toolbar PageRank disappeared reverting to n/a. I'm talking a site with a homepage toolbar PR 7 showing PR n/a! It was a very strange experience, made all the more strange by the fact that sites that ranked on pure age (been there since god was a boy with decent content) tanked alongside sites we'd worked on. Read this post By: Will Critchlow August 13, 2012 How to Learn SEO SEO Basics At Distilled, we define our purpose as "discovering, implementing and sharing the ways great companies succeed online". It should come as no surprise, then, to learn that (a) I think a lot about how to learn SEO effectively and (b) we try to build learning into pretty much everything we do. "How should I learn more about X?"... Read this post By: Kyle Claypool July 16, 2012 Listening to the Web with Google Reader: A Beginner's Guide SEO Basics This post is about building a listening machine for the web. We’re fans of the cheap (or free) DIY approach. If you have hundreds or thousands of dollars a month, tools like Radian6 are great. For the rest of us, we can create a pretty powerful listening tool with the following.... Read this post T By: Tom Critchlow May 13, 2012 Project Management for SEO (2012 Edition!) SEO Consulting | SEO Basics How not to suck at project management and take your work, business, and team to the next level. Read this post J By: Joe Youngblood March 27, 2012 Free SEO Advice & Marketing Tips for the Music Industry SEO Basics Music is one of the most popular forms of entertainment and one of the most traded digital assets on the planet. Ever since Napster's debut in 1999 musicians, record labels and the RIAA have all singled out file sharing as the overwhelming source for loss of revenue in record sales. I have always wondered why they get to point all of these crazy fingers without highlighting how absolutely awful they are at marketing their products on the Internet – not to mention how little they seem to care about the revenue they lose to their own horribleness. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers March 7, 2012 An Open Letter to New SEOs SEO Basics You're entering the field of SEO at an amazing time, where there seem to be more jobs than people. So, why aren't you getting hired? I offer you some fatherly advice. Read this post By: Steve Webb, Ph.D. February 3, 2012 What Super Bowl Commercials Can Teach Us About SEO SEO Basics Now, I know what you're thinking: "Steve just wrote this post so he could watch old Super Bowl commercials." And you're not wrong ;-) I'll jump at any chance to watch (and share) YouTube videos. Fortunately, in the process of sifting through my favorite ads from years past, I was able to select a few videos that can actually teach us valuable SEO lessons. So sit back, and enjoy these all-time great Super Bowl commercials, while I drop a few SEO nuggets of knowledge along the way. Read this post
